00013 void bro_encode_sci_datablock (bro_fist_t *data_block, double *params)
00014 {
00015     switch ((uint8_t)params[1])
00016     {
00017         case 1:
00018             data_block->port = PORT_1;
00019             break;
00020         case 2:
00021             data_block->port = PORT_2;
00022             break;
00023         case 3:
00024             data_block->port = PORT_3;
00025             break;
00026         case 4:
00027             data_block->port = PORT_4;
00028             break;
00029         case 5:
00030             data_block->port = MOTOR_A;
00031             break;
00032         case 6:
00033             data_block->port = MOTOR_B;
00034             break;
00035         case 7:
00036             data_block->port = MOTOR_C;
00037             break;
00038         default:
00039             break;
00040     };
00041     
00042     switch ((uint8_t)params[2])
00043     {
00044         case 1:
00045             data_block->operation = TACHO_COUNT;
00046             break;
00047         case 2:
00048             data_block->operation = AVG_SPEED;
00049             break;
00050         case 3:
00051             data_block->operation = LIGHT_SENSOR;
00052             break;
00053         case 4:
00054             data_block->operation = TOUCH_SENSOR;
00055             break;
00056         case 5:
00057             data_block->operation = SOUND_SENSOR;
00058             break;
00059         case 6:
00060             data_block->operation = RADAR_SENSOR;
00061             break;
00062         case 7:
00063             data_block->operation = SET_POWER;
00064             break;
00065         case 8:
00066             data_block->operation = SET_SPEED;
00067             break;
00068         default:
00069             break;
00070     };
00071     
00072     data_block->data = (float)params[3];
00073 }

00075 void bro_decode_sci_datablock (bro_fist_t *data_block, double *param)
00076 {
00077     printf("Ho ricevuto il dato: %.2f\n", data_block->data);
00078     *param = (double)data_block->data;
00079 }

00082 int bro_comm_init (scicos_block *block)
00083 {
00084     int rc, length;
00085     // char   buffer[BUFFER_LENGTH];
00086     struct sockaddr_un serveraddr;
00087     int global_sd = -1;
00088     
00089     printf("Init. Socket\n");
00090     
00091     /********************************************************************/
00092     /* The socket() function returns a socket descriptor, which represents   */
00093     /* an endpoint.  The statement also identifies that the UNIX  */
00094     /* address family with the stream transport (SOCK_STREAM) will be   */
00095     /* used for this socket.                                            */
00096     /********************************************************************/
00097     global_sd = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00098     if (global_sd < 0)
00099     {
00100         perror("socket() failed");
00101         return -1;
00102     }
00103 
00104 
00105     printf("Linking it to the system socket\n");
00106     /********************************************************************/
00107     /* If an argument was passed in, use this as the server, otherwise  */
00108     /* use the #define that is located at the top of this program.      */
00109     /********************************************************************/
00110     memset(&serveraddr, 0, sizeof(serveraddr));
00111     serveraddr.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
00112     strcpy(serveraddr.sun_path, SERVER_PATH);
00113     
00114     printf("Connecting...\n");
00115     
00116     /********************************************************************/
00117     /* Use the connect() function to establish a connection to the      */
00118     /* server.                                                          */
00119     /********************************************************************/
00120     rc = connect(global_sd, (struct sockaddr *)&serveraddr, SUN_LEN(&serveraddr));
00121     if (rc < 0)
00122     {
00123         perror("connect() failed");
00124         return -1;
00125     }
00126 
00127     printf("Done, setting connection params :3\n");
00128     length = sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE;
00129     rc = setsockopt(global_sd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVLOWAT,
00130     (char *)&length, sizeof(length));
00131 
00132     if (rc < 0)
00133     {
00134         perror("setsockopt(SO_RCVLOWAT) failed");
00135         return -1;
00136     }
00137 
00138     printf("Ok, all done!\n");
00139     
00140     block->outptr[0][0] = global_sd;
00141     
00142     return 0;
00143 }

00146 int bro_comm_kill (scicos_block *block)
00147 {
00148     int rc;
00149     bro_fist_t packet[BUFFER_SIZE];
00150     
00151     packet[0].operation = 255;
00152     
00153     rc = send(block->inptr[0][0], &packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
00154     
00155     if (rc < 0)
00156     {
00157         perror("send() failed");
00158         return -1;
00159     }
00160     
00161     close(block->outptr[0][0]);
00162     
00163     return 0;
00164 }

00166 void bro_comm_controller (scicos_block *block, int flag)
00167 {
00168         switch (flag) {
00169                 case 1: /* set output */
00170                     break;
00171                 case 2: /* get input */
00172                         break;
00173                 case 4: /* initialisation */
00174                     bro_comm_init(block);
00175                 break;
00176                 case 5: /* ending */
00177                         bro_comm_kill(block);
00178                         break;
00179             default:
00180                 break;
00181         }
00182 }

00184 int bro_sens_send (scicos_block *block)
00185 {
00186     int rc, i;
00187     bro_fist_t packet[BUFFER_SIZE];
00188     
00189     for (i = 1; i < block->nin; i++) {
00190         bro_encode_sci_datablock(&packet[i-1], block->inptr[i]);
00191     };
00192     
00193     printf ("Data for first block: %i, %i, %.2f\n", packet[0].port, packet[0].operation, packet[0].data);
00194     
00195     rc = send(block->inptr[0][0], packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
00196     
00197     if (rc < 0)
00198     {
00199         perror("send() failed");
00200         return -1;
00201     }
00202 
00203     printf("%d bytes of data were sent\n", rc);
00204     return 0;
00205 }
00206 
00207 int bro_sens_read (scicos_block *block)
00208 {
00209     int rc, i;
00210     bro_fist_t packet[BUFFER_SIZE];
00211     
00212     rc = recv(block->inptr[0][0], packet, sizeof(bro_fist_t) * BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
00213     printf("%d bytes of data were received\n", rc);
00214     if (rc < 0)
00215     {
00216         perror("recv() failed");
00217         return -1;
00218     }
00219     
00220     printf("Starting to set outputs :3 [%i]\n", block->nout);
00221     
00222     for (i = 0; i < block->nout; i++) {
00223         printf("Next Step defining outputs :D [%i]\n", i);
00224         bro_decode_sci_datablock(&packet[i], &block->outptr[i][0]);
00225         printf("Output value for port %i is: %.2f[%i]\n", i, block->outptr[i][0], block->outsz[(2*block->nout)+i]);
00226         
00227     }
00228     
00229     return 0;
00230 }

00242                 break;

00244                         break;

00246                 break;
